org.jboss.msc.service

Interface Service<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - the service value type

    public interface Service<T>
    Service interface providing both start and stop methods to implementors.

    Service implementors will have start invoked both on execution phase (when the service is being started) and during rollback (when a stop is being reverted). The same is valid for stop: it could be invoked during both execution and rollback stages of active transaction.

    Author:
    Flavia Rainone

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void start(StartContext<T> startContext)
      Service start method, invoked on execution and rollback (when needed to revert a previous stop).
      void stop(StopContext stopContext)
      Service stop method, invoked on execution and rollback (when needed to revert a previous start).

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start(StartContext<T> startContext)
        Service start method, invoked on execution and rollback (when needed to revert a previous stop).

        Implementors must invoke startContext.complete(T) upon completion.

        Also, this method cannot be implemented asynchronously.

        Parameters:
        startContext - the start context

      • stop

        void stop(StopContext stopContext)
        Service stop method, invoked on execution and rollback (when needed to revert a previous start).

        Implementors must invoke stopContext.complete() upon completion.

        Also, this method cannot be implemented asynchronously.

        Parameters:
        stopContext - the stop context
